abstract: At every Wells Fargo water cooler this week, middle managers were undoubtedly showing off their Michael Corleone impersonations after the company announced that its board had voted to waive its mandatory retirement age so that it could pull back in its accomplished chairman, Dick Kovacevich.
lead_paragraph: At every Wells Fargo water cooler this week, middle managers were undoubtedly showing off their Michael Corleone impersonations after the company announced that its board had voted to waive its mandatory retirement age so that it could pull back in its accomplished chairman, Dick Kovacevich.

headline.main: Parsing Wells Fargo: Just When He Thought He Was Out…
